reactor.io.net

Class ChannelStream<IN,OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.rx.Stream<IN>
      • reactor.io.net.ChannelStream<IN,OUT>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.reactivestreams.Publisher<IN>, NonBlocking, ReactorChannel<IN,OUT>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpChannel, NettyChannelStream, ZeroMQChannelStream

    public abstract class ChannelStream<IN,OUT>
extends Stream<IN>
implements ReactorChannel<IN,OUT>
    An abstract ReactorChannel implementation that handles the basic interaction and behave as a Stream.
    Author:
    Jon Brisbin, Stephane Maldini

      • writeWith

        public final Stream<Void> writeWith(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<? extends OUT> source)
        Description copied from interface: ReactorChannel
        Send data to the peer, listen for any error on write and close on terminal signal (complete|error). If more than one publisher is attached (multiple calls to writeWith()) completion occurs after all publishers complete.
        Specified by:
        writeWith in interface ReactorChannel<IN,OUT>
        Parameters:
        source - the dataStream publishing OUT items to write on this channel
        Returns:
        A Publisher to signal successful sequence write (e.g. after "flush") or any error during write

        Returns:
